DOC.brief_summary: The achievement of peripheral nerve block requires several needle passes, with each of them being at risk of causing nerve injury either by direct trauma or intraneural injection even with the use of the ultrasound. The ultrasound guided supraclavicular brachial plexus block is known to be at risk of pneumothorax and / or nerve injury. This study is designed to determine the maximal effective distance away from the nerve for the injection to be effective.
DOC.brief_title: Maximal Distance for Successful Supraclavicular Block
DOC.criteria: ASA physical status IIII 1885 years of age, inclusive surgery less than 3 hours contraindications to brachial plexus block (e.g., allergy to local anesthetics, coagulopathy, malignancy or infection in the area) existing neurological deficit in the area to be blocked pregnancy history of neck surgery or radiotherapy inability to understand the informed consent and demands of the study
